description: From Middle English forsprecen, from Old English foresprecen (“spoken or mentioned before; forespoken”), past participle of Old English foresprecan (“to forespeak”), equivalent to fore- +‎ spoken; also, as the past participle of forespeak, equivalent to forespeak +‎ -en.

adjectives.description: forespoken (comparative more forespoken, superlative most forespoken)

entries.meaning: Spoken beforehand or in advance; foretold; predicted.
